Document_Clauses.Name: Terms and Conditions of Sale
Document_Clauses.DxCPQ__Body__c:
Terms and Conditions of Sale

1. Applicability. These terms and conditions of sale (these "Terms") are the only terms which govern the sale of the compressed

natural gas fuel system components ("Goods") by Natural Gas Fuel Systems, LLC., doing business as Cummins Clean Fuel Technologies

("Seller"), to buyer ("Buyer"). The Seller’s invoice and these Terms (collectively, this "Agreement") comprise the entire agreement between the parties, and supersede all prior or contemporaneous understandings, agreements, negotiations, representations and warranties, and communications, both written and oral. These Terms prevail over any of Buyer's general terms and conditions of purchase regardless whether or when Buyer has submitted its purchase order or such terms. Fulfillment of Buyer's order does not constitute acceptance of any of Buyer's terms and conditions and does not serve to modify or amend these Terms. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, if a written contract signed by both parties is in existence covering the sale of the Goods covered hereby, the terms and conditions of said contract shall prevail to the extent they are inconsistent with these Terms.

2. Delivery. Delivery shall be made FOB Seller’s facility by the method preferred by Buyer if indicated on Buyer’s purchase order. Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the parties, Seller shall use Seller's standard methods for packaging Goods and have them prepared for shipment at Seller’s facility (the "Delivery Point"). Delivery shall be deemed to have occurred when the Goods have been delivered to the Delivery Point and loaded onto a common carrier for delivery. Buyer shall be responsible for all unloading costs and provide equipment and labor reasonably suited for receipt of the Goods at the destination (the “Delivery Location”). Seller may, in its sole discretion, without liability or penalty, make partial shipments of Goods to Buyer. Each shipment will constitute a separate sale, and Buyer shall pay for the units shipped whether such shipment is in whole or partial fulfillment of Buyer's purchase order.

3. Invoicing. Upon delivery, Seller will issue an invoice to Buyer setting forth the following: (i) Buyer’s purchase order number; (ii) the Delivery Location; (iii) a description of the Goods; (iv) the price of the Goods; (v) freight costs; and (vi) taxes and other fees. Unless specifically stated on the Invoice, the price on the Invoice does not include sales or use taxes or occupational taxes based on sales volume (federal, state or local). Seller shall not bill for Federal Excise Tax and will not remit any Federal Excise Tax. Buyer agrees to pay any taxes imposed or applicable to the transaction. All invoices shall be in United States Dollars, unless otherwise specifically stated.

4. Payment Terms. Buyer shall pay all invoiced amounts due to Seller within 30 days from the date of Seller's invoice. Buyer shall pay interest on all late payments at the lesser of the rate of 1.5% per month or the highest rate permissible under applicable law, calculated daily and compounded monthly. Buyer shall reimburse Seller for all costs incurred in collecting any late payments, including, without limitation, attorneys' fees. In addition to all other remedies available under these Terms or at law (which Seller does not waive by the exercise of any rights hereunder), Seller shall be entitled to suspend the delivery of any Goods if Buyer fails to pay any amounts when due hereunder and such failure continues for 5 days following written notice thereof. Buyer shall not withhold payment of any amounts due and payable by reason of any set-off of any claim or dispute with Seller, whether relating to Seller's breach, bankruptcy or otherwise.

5. Title and Risk of Loss. Title and risk of loss passes to Buyer upon delivery of the Goods at the Delivery Point. As collateral security for the payment of the purchase price of the Goods, Buyer hereby grants to Seller a lien on and security interest in and to all of the right, title and interest of Buyer in, to and under the Goods, wherever located, and whether now existing or hereafter arising or acquired from time to time, and in all accessions thereto and replacements or modifications thereof, as well as all proceeds (including insurance proceeds) of the foregoing. The security interest granted under this provision constitutes a purchase money security interest under the Texas Uniform Commercial Code.

6. Inspection and Rejection of Nonconforming Goods.

(a) Buyer shall inspect the Goods within 10 days of receipt ("Inspection Period"). Buyer will be deemed to have accepted the Goods unless it notifies Seller in writing of any Nonconforming Goods during the Inspection Period and furnishes such written evidence or other documentation as reasonably required by Seller. For purposes of these Terms, "Nonconforming Goods" means only the following: (i) product shipped is different than identified in Buyer's purchase order; or (ii) product's label or packaging incorrectly identifies its contents. If Buyer timely notifies Seller of any Nonconforming Goods, Seller shall, in its sole discretion, (i) replace such Nonconforming Goods with conforming Goods, or (ii) credit or refund the Price for such Nonconforming Goods, together with any reasonable shipping and handling expenses incurred by Buyer in connection therewith. Buyer shall ship, at Seller’s expense and risk of loss, the Nonconforming Goods to Seller's facility as instructed by Seller. If Seller exercises its option to replace Nonconforming Goods, Seller shall, after receiving Buyer's shipment of Nonconforming Goods, ship to Buyer, at Buyer's expense and risk of loss, the replaced Goods to the Delivery Location or such alternate location as designated by Buyer. Buyer acknowledges and agrees that the remedies set forth in Section 6 are Buyer's exclusive remedies for the delivery of Nonconforming Goods. Except as provided under Section 6, all sales of Goods to Buyer are made on a one-way basis and Buyer has no right to return Goods purchased under this Agreement to Seller.

7. Limited Warranty. The limited warranty covering the goods is provided separately to Buyer and incorporated herein by reference. EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY PROVIDED TO BUYER, SELLER MAKES NO ADDITIONAL WARRANTIES WHATSOEVER WITH RESPECT TO THE GOODS.

8. Limitation of Liability. IN NO EVENT SHALL SELLER BE LIABLE FOR ANY CONSEQUENTIAL, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,

SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, LOST PROFITS OR REVENUES OR DIMINUTION IN VALUE, ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO ANY BREACH OF THESE TERMS, WHETHER OR NOT THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES HAS BEEN DISCLOSED IN ADVANCE BY BUYER OR COULD HAVE BEEN REASONABLY FORESEEN BY BUYER, REGARDLESS OF THE LEGAL OR EQUITABLE THEORY (CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE) UPON WHICH THE CLAIM IS BASED, AND NOTWITHSTANDING THE FAILURE OF ANY AGREED OR OTHER REMEDY OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL SELLER'S AGGREGATE LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE, EXCEED THE TOTAL OF THE AMOUNTS PAID TO SELLER FOR THE GOODS SOLD HEREUNDER.

9. Waiver. No waiver by Seller of any of the provisions of this Agreement is effective unless explicitly set forth in writing and signed by Seller. No failure to exercise, or delay in exercising, any right, remedy, power or privilege arising from this Agreement operates, or may be construed, as a waiver thereof. No single or partial exercise of any right, remedy, power or privilege hereunder precludes any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other right, remedy, power or privilege.

10. Confidential Information. All non-public, confidential or proprietary information of Seller, including but not limited to specifications, samples, designs, plans, drawings, documents, data, business operations, pricing, discounts or rebates, disclosed by Seller to Buyer, whether disclosed orally or disclosed or accessed in written, electronic or other form or media, and whether or not marked, designated or otherwise identified as "confidential" in connection with the purchase of Goods is confidential and may not be disclosed or copied unless authorized in advance by Seller in writing. This Section does not apply to information that is: (a) in the public domain; (b) known to Buyer at the time of disclosure; or (c) rightfully obtained by Buyer on a non-confidential basis from a third party.

11. No Third-Party Beneficiaries. This Agreement is for the sole benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and permitted assigns and nothing herein, express or implied, is intended to or shall confer upon any other person or entity any legal or equitable right, benefit or remedy of any nature whatsoever under or by reason of these Terms.

12. Governing Law. All matters arising out of or relating to this Agreement is governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Texas without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of Texas or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than those of the State of Texas.

13. Submission to Jurisdiction. Any legal suit, action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be instituted in the federal courts of the United States of America or the courts of the State of Texas in each case located in the City of San Antonio and County of Bexar, and each party irrevocably submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts in any such suit, action or proceeding.

﻿14. Notices. All notices, request, consents, claims, demands, waivers and other communications hereunder (each, a "Notice") shall be in writing and addressed to the parties at the addresses set forth on Seller’s invoice or to such other address that may be designated by the receiving party in writing. All Notices shall be delivered by personal delivery, nationally recognized overnight courier (with all fees pre-paid) or certified or registered mail (in each case, return receipt requested, postage prepaid). Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, a Notice is effective only (a) upon receipt of the receiving party, and (b) if the party giving the Notice has complied with the requirements of this Section.

15. Execution and Delivery by Electronic Transmission. If any document executed in connection with an order for Goods is delivered by facsimile, email or similar instantaneous electronic transmission device pursuant to which the signature of or on behalf of such party can be seen, such execution and delivery shall be considered valid, binding and effective for all purposes as an original document. Any such faxed or emailed document shall be considered to have the same binding legal effect as an original document. At the request of Seller, any faxed or emailed document shall be re-executed by Buyer in an original form.

16. Severability. If any term or provision of this Agreement is invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any jurisdiction, such invalidity, illegality

or unenforceability shall not affect any other term or provision of this Agreement or invalidate or render unenforceable such term or provision in any other jurisdiction.

Document_Clauses.Name: Dextara T&C
Document_Clauses.DxCPQ__Body__c:
Price Quotes

• Prices quoted are good for 30 days unless otherwise noted.

• All material subject to availability at time of order.

• Shipping charges are estimated, and will be reviewed/re-quoted upon completion of the order. Any adjustments may be reflected on the final invoice.

• All orders under $5,000 require payment in full to initiate order.

• All orders with a 4 week or less lead time require payment in full to initiate order.

• The customer is responsible for material quantity estimates including take-offs. Pioneer Millworks does not provide take-off services. Customer is also

responsible for adding sufficient quantity to cover installation & cutting waste.


Proposal

• A signed proposal and a non-refundable deposit are required to initiate your order.

• Customer is responsible for ensuring that the proposal and order confirmation accurately list the sizes, quantities, grades, and species that they are ordering

as well as accurate bill to and ship to information.

• A signed proposal constitutes acceptance of our terms and conditions of the sale and acceptance of the order as it is written including material specifications.

• Customers with tax exempt certification must provide a copy of the certificate with their proposal.

• Unless otherwise noted as “finished face”, Tongue and Groove flooring and paneling widths are nominal, which means the actual face width is 1/2 less than

nominal width indicated. Other items are listed at net width unless noted.


Lead Time

• Lead time estimates are provided on the proposal and order confirmation and are dependent upon material availability and production loading at the time of

order.

• Lead time begins upon receipt of your deposit and signed proposal, and spans to the date of shipment from our shop.

• Pioneer Millworks is not responsible for transit times issued by our shippers.


Change Orders & Deletions

• Changes to orders after the proposal is signed and accepted are subject to a $125 fee which will be added to the final invoice. This includes changes to taxes

due to ship to location or missing tax-exempt documentation.

• Changes accepted after production has begun are subject to an additional fee of 20% of the total product price on the order plus any additional costs due to

interruption of normal production.

• Lead time will be adjusted according to the nature of the change order.

• Changes resulting in additions of more than 30% of the price of the original order require an additional deposit for the order to be continued.


Final Payment

• Final payment including shipping & handling charges and sales tax, if applicable, is due upon completion of the order and prior to material leaving our facility.

• Applicable sales tax will be included on final invoice for deliveries to CA, CO, GA, IL, MA, MI, NJ, NY, TX, VT, VA and WA, unless an approved exemption or

resale certificate is presented at time of order.

• Clients are invited to inspect their order at our facility prior to shipment.

• Payments can be made by Check, ACH, Wire Transfer or Credit Card.

• Credit Card and ACH payments can be made at pioneermillworks.com/pay-online

• Our credit card processor will charge a 2.5% service fee for all credit card transactions.


Material Storage

• We will readily store your materials for one month at no cost from the date your order is complete if the final invoice has been paid.

• If final payment is not received within 30 days of completion of the order, a per pallet storage fee will be charged from the date of storage as described below.

• We will store your order for a fee for up to 12 months after your order is completed « Storage fees are $200/mo for the first pallet and $100/mo for each

additional pallet « Abandonment: If your materials remain in storage more than 12 months, we will make every effort to establish contact with you to arrange

shipment or to extend this Agreement. If, after good-faith efforts to contact you are unsuccessful, we will after 13 months from original storage date, dispose of

your materials without any remuneration to you.


Acclimation & Installation

• Pioneer Millworks cannot and does not take any responsibility for installation issues or problems resulting from installation of any Pioneer Millworks products.

• The customer accepts full responsibility for such issues which can include lost labor, removal labor, reinstallation labor and/or materials for any reason

including the following: « Failure to properly inspect material prior to installation. « Failure to properly install various color and size mixes as recommended and

shown in reference photos. Failure to follow National Wood Flooring Association (NWFA) installation and maintenance guidelines. Failure to use a licensed

contractor.

• We recommend installation and finishing by a qualified professional wood flooring contractor.

• All flooring must be properly acclimated in the space where the floor will be installed prior to laying the floor according to NWFA guidelines. See our

Acclimation and Installation Guides at https://pioneermillworks.com/customer-resources

• For further information specific to proper acclimation and installation of wood flooring, please consult the National Wood Flooring Association.

• If your flooring, paneling, or siding is ordered as “random width,” you will receive enough total square footage to cover the quantity ordered. Width distribution

may not be consistent


Additional Terms:

• Samples are a representation only

• Barn siding and other reclaimed wood materials with original paint may contain lead. The purchaser/user is responsible for encapsulation, as well as

appropriate precautions during handling and installation. We recommend consulting your local regulations for guidance.

• All reclaimed wood will show signs of previous use including nail and bolt holes, cracks, staining and insect marks.

• Pre-finished materials should be maintained according to finish manufacturer’s recommendations.

Document_Clauses.Name: French Terms and Conditions
Document_Clauses.DxCPQ__Body__c:
Conditions Générales de Vente

  1. Applicabilité. Ces conditions générales de vente (les "Conditions") sont les seules conditions régissant la vente des composants du système de carburant au gaz naturel compressé (les "Biens") par Natural Gas Fuel Systems, LLC, faisant affaire sous le nom de Cummins Clean Fuel Technologies ("Vendeur"), à l'acheteur ("Acheteur"). La facture du Vendeur et ces Conditions (collectivement, cet "Accord") constituent l'intégralité de l'accord entre les parties, et prévalent sur toutes les compréhensions, accords, négociations, représentations, garanties et communications antérieurs ou contemporains, qu'ils soient écrits ou verbaux. Ces Conditions prévalent sur toutes les conditions générales d'achat de l'Acheteur, peu importe que l'Acheteur ait soumis ou non sa commande d'achat ou de telles conditions. L'exécution de la commande de l'Acheteur ne constitue pas l'acceptation de l'une quelconque des conditions de l'Acheteur et ne sert pas à modifier ou à amender ces Conditions. Nonobstant toute disposition contraire aux présentes, si un contrat écrit signé par les deux parties existe couvrant la vente des Biens couverts par les présentes, les termes et conditions dudit contrat prévaudront dans la mesure où ils sont incompatibles avec ces Conditions.
  2. Livraison. La livraison sera effectuée départ usine du Vendeur par la méthode préférée par l'Acheteur si indiquée dans la commande d'achat de l'Acheteur. À moins d'un accord écrit contraire des parties, le Vendeur utilisera ses méthodes standard d'emballage des Biens et les préparera pour l'expédition à l'usine du Vendeur (le "Point de Livraison"). La livraison sera réputée avoir eu lieu lorsque les Biens auront été livrés au Point de Livraison et chargés sur un transporteur commun en vue de la livraison. L'Acheteur sera responsable de tous les coûts de déchargement et fournira l'équipement et la main-d'œuvre raisonnablement adaptés à la réception des Biens à la destination (le "Lieu de Livraison"). Le Vendeur peut, à sa seule discrétion, sans responsabilité ni pénalité, effectuer des expéditions partielles de Biens à l'Acheteur. Chaque expédition constituera une vente distincte, et l'Acheteur paiera pour les unités expédiées que cette expédition soit ou non un complément total ou partiel de la commande d'achat de l'Acheteur.
  3. Facturation. À la livraison, le Vendeur émettra une facture à l'Acheteur indiquant ce qui suit : (i) le numéro de commande d'achat de l'Acheteur ; (ii) le Lieu de Livraison ; (iii) une description des Biens ; (iv) le prix des Biens ; (v) les frais de transport ; et (vi) les taxes et autres frais. Sauf indication expresse sur la facture, le prix sur la facture n'inclut pas les taxes de vente ou d'utilisation ou les taxes professionnelles basées sur le volume des ventes (fédérales, étatiques ou locales). Le Vendeur ne facturera pas la Taxe Fédérale sur les Accises et ne versera aucune Taxe Fédérale sur les Accises. L'Acheteur accepte de payer toutes les taxes imposées ou applicables à la transaction. Toutes les factures seront en dollars américains, sauf indication contraire expresse.
  4. Conditions de Paiement. L'Acheteur paiera tous les montants facturés dus au Vendeur dans les 30 jours suivant la date de la facture du Vendeur. L'Acheteur paiera des intérêts sur tous les paiements tardifs au taux le plus bas entre 1,5 % par mois ou le taux le plus élevé autorisé en vertu de la loi applicable, calculé quotidiennement et composé mensuellement. L'Acheteur remboursera au Vendeur tous les frais engagés pour recouvrer les paiements tardifs, y compris, sans limitation, les honoraires d'avocats. En plus de tous les autres recours disponibles en vertu de ces Conditions ou en droit (que le Vendeur ne renonce pas par l'exercice de ses droits aux termes des présentes), le Vendeur aura le droit de suspendre la livraison de tout Bien si l'Acheteur omet de payer tout montant dû aux termes des présentes et si un tel défaut se poursuit pendant 5 jours suivant notification écrite à cet effet. L'Acheteur ne retiendra pas le paiement d'aucun montant dû et payable en raison d'une compensation d'une quelconque réclamation ou dispute avec le Vendeur, que ce soit en relation avec la violation du Vendeur, la faillite ou autre.
  5. Titre et Risque de Perte. Le titre et le risque de perte passent à l'Acheteur dès la livraison des Biens au Point de Livraison. En garantie pour le paiement du prix d'achat des Biens, l'Acheteur accorde par la présente au Vendeur un privilège sur et une sûreté sur tous les droits, titres et intérêts de l'Acheteur dans, sur et sous les Biens, où qu'ils soient situés, qu'ils existent actuellement ou soient établis ou acquis de temps à autre, ainsi que sur toutes leurs accessions et remplacements ou modifications, ainsi que sur tous les produits (y compris les produits d'assurance) de ce qui précède. La sûreté accordée en vertu de cette disposition constitue une sûreté de financement d'achat en vertu du Code Commercial Uniforme du Texas.
  6. Inspection et Rejet des Biens Non Conformes. (a) L'Acheteur inspectera les Biens dans les 10 jours suivant la réception (la "Période d'Inspection"). L'Acheteur sera réputé avoir accepté les Biens sauf s'il notifie par écrit au Vendeur tout Bien Non Conforme pendant la Période d'Inspection et fournit les preuves écrites ou autres documents raisonnablement requis par le Vendeur. Aux fins des présentes Conditions, "Biens Non Conformes" signifie uniquement ce qui suit : (i) le produit expédié est différent de celui identifié dans la commande d'achat de l'Acheteur ; ou (ii) l'étiquette ou l'emballage du produit identifie incorrectement son contenu. Si l'Acheteur notifie en temps voulu le Vendeur de tout Bien Non Conforme, le Vendeur pourra, à sa seule discrétion, (i) remplacer de tels Biens Non Conformes par des Biens conformes, ou (ii) créditer ou rembourser le Prix de tels Biens Non Conformes, ainsi que les frais raisonnables d'expédition et de manutention supportés par l'Acheteur à cet égard. L'Acheteur expédiera, aux frais et risques du Vendeur, les Biens Non Conformes à l'usine du Vendeur selon les instructions du Vendeur. Si le Vendeur exerce son option de remplacer les Biens Non Conformes, le Vendeur expédiera, après réception de l'expédition des Biens Non Conformes de l'Acheteur, à l'Acheteur, aux frais et risques de l'Acheteur, les Biens remplacés au Lieu de Livraison ou à tout autre lieu alternatif désigné par l'Acheteur. L'Acheteur reconnaît et accepte que les recours énoncés à la Section 6 sont les recours exclusifs de l'Acheteur pour la livraison de Biens Non Conformes. Sauf disposition contraire de la Section 6, toutes les ventes de Biens à l'Acheteur sont effectuées de manière unilatérale et l'Acheteur n'a aucun droit de retourner les Biens achetés en vertu de cet Accord au Vendeur.
  7. Garantie Limitée. La garantie limitée couvrant les biens est fournie séparément à l'Acheteur et est incorporée par référence aux présentes. SAUF POUR LA GARANTIE LIMITÉE FOURNIE À L'ACHETEUR, LE VENDEUR NE FOURNIT AUCUNE GARANTIE ADDITIONNELLE QUE CE SOIT EN CE QUI CONCERNE LES BIENS.
  8. Limitation de Responsabilité. EN AUCUN CAS LE VENDEUR NE SERA RESPONSABLE POUR TOUT DOMMAGE INDIRECT, ACCESSOIRE, SPÉCIAL, EXEMPLAIRE OU PUNITIF, PERTES DE BÉNÉFICES OU REVENUS OU DIMINUTION DE LA VALEUR, DÉCOULANT OU RELATIFS À TOUTE VIOLATION DE CES CONDITIONS, QUE LA POSSIBILITÉ DE TELS DOMMAGES AIT ÉTÉ DIVULGUÉE À L'AVANCE PAR L'ACHETEUR OU AURAIT PU ÊTRE RAISONNABLEMENT PRÉVUE PAR L'ACHETEUR, INDÉPENDAMMENT DE LA THÉORIE LÉGALE OU ÉQUITABLE (CONTRAT, DÉLIT OU AUTREMENT) SUR LAQUELLE LA RÉCLAMATION EST BASÉE, ET NONOBSTANT LE DÉFAUT DE TOUT ACCORDÉ OU AUTRE RECOURS DE SON OBJECTIF ESSENTIEL. EN AUCUN CAS LA RESPONSABILITÉ GLOBALE DU VENDEUR DÉCOULANT OU RELATIVE À CET ACCORD, QUE CELA DÉCOULE OU SOIT LIÉ À LA RUPTURE DE CONTRAT, AU DÉLIT (Y COMPRIS LA NÉGLIGENCE) OU AUTREMENT, NE DÉPASSERA LE TOTAL DES MONTANTS PAYÉS AU VENDEUR POUR LES BIENS VENDUS AUX TERMES DES PRÉSENTES.
  9. Renonciation. Aucune renonciation par le Vendeur à l'une des dispositions de cet Accord n'est efficace à moins qu'elle ne soit explicitement énoncée par écrit et signée par le Vendeur. Aucune omission d'exercer, ou retard dans l'exercice, de tout droit, recours, pouvoir ou privilège découlant de cet Accord n'opère, ou ne peut être interprété, comme une renonciation à celui-ci. Aucun exercice unique ou partiel de tout droit, recours, pouvoir ou privilège en vertu des présentes n'empêche tout autre exercice ultérieur de celui-ci ou l'exercice de tout autre droit, recours, pouvoir ou privilège.
  10. Informations Confidentielles. Toute information non publique, confidentielle ou propriétaire du Vendeur, y compris, sans s'y limiter, les spécifications, échantillons, designs, plans, dessins, documents, données, opérations commerciales, prix, remises ou rabais, divulgués par le Vendeur à l'Acheteur, que ce soit oralement ou divulgué ou accessible sous forme écrite, électronique ou autre forme ou média, et que ce soit marqué, désigné ou autrement identifié comme "confidentiel" dans le cadre de l'achat des Biens, est confidentielle et ne peut être divulguée ou copiée sauf autorisation préalable écrite du Vendeur. Cette Section ne s'applique pas aux informations qui sont : (a) dans le domaine public ; (b) connues de l'Acheteur au moment de la divulgation ; ou (c) obtenues de bonne foi par l'Acheteur sur une base non confidentielle auprès d'un tiers.
  11. Pas de Bénéficiaires Tiers. Cet Accord est pour le seul bénéfice des parties et de leurs successeurs respectifs et des cessionnaires autorisés et rien ici, expressément ou implicitement, n'est destiné à ou conférera à toute autre personne ou entité tout droit, avantage ou recours légal ou équitable de quelque nature que ce soit en vertu de ces Conditions.
  12. Droit Applicable. Toutes les questions découlant de cet Accord sont régies par et interprétées conformément aux lois internes de l'État du Texas sans donner effet à toute disposition de choix de loi ou de règle de conflit de lois (qu'elles soient de l'État du Texas ou de toute autre juridiction) qui pourrait entraîner l'application des lois d'une juridiction autre que celles de l'État du Texas.
  13. Soumission à la Juridiction. Toute action en justice, action ou procédure découlant de cet Accord doit être intentée devant les tribunaux fédéraux des États-Unis d'Amérique ou les tribunaux de l'État du Texas, chacun situé dans la ville de San Antonio et le comté de Bexar, et chaque partie se soumet irrévocablement à la compétence exclusive de ces tribunaux dans toute action en justice, action ou procédure.
  14. Avis. Tous les avis, demandes, consentements, réclamations, exigences, renonciations et autres communications en vertu des présentes (chacun, un "Avis") doivent être faits par écrit et adressés aux parties aux adresses indiquées sur la facture du Vendeur ou à toute autre adresse qui peut être désignée par la partie recevant l'avis par écrit. Tous les Avis doivent être livrés par livraison personnelle, coursier de nuit reconnu nationalement (tous frais prépayés) ou par courrier certifié ou recommandé (dans chaque cas, avec accusé de réception demandé, affranchissement prépayé). Sauf disposition contraire dans cet Accord, un Avis est effectif seulement (a) dès réception par la partie recevant l'Avis, et (b) si la partie donnant l'Avis a respecté les exigences de cette Section.
  15. Exécution et Livraison par Transmission Électronique. Si tout document exécuté dans le cadre d'une commande de Biens est livré par télécopie, courrier électronique ou tout autre dispositif de transmission électronique instantanée similaire selon lequel la signature de, ou au nom de, une telle partie peut être vue, une telle exécution et livraison seront considérées comme valides, contraignantes et efficaces pour tous les besoins comme un document original. Tout document télécopié ou envoyé par courrier électronique sera considéré avoir le même effet juridique contraignant qu'un document original. À la demande du Vendeur, tout document télécopié ou envoyé par courrier électronique sera re-signé par l'Acheteur dans une forme originale.
  16. Séparabilité. Si une disposition ou une clause de cet Accord est invalide, illégale ou inapplicable dans une juridiction, cette invalidité, illégalité ou inapplicabilité n'affectera pas les autres dispositions ou clauses de cet Accord ou n'invalidera ou ne rendra pas inapplicables une telle disposition ou clause dans toute autre juridiction.

Document_Clauses.Name: Spanish Terms and Conditions
Document_Clauses.DxCPQ__Body__c:
Términos y Condiciones de Venta

  1. Aplicabilidad. Estos términos y condiciones de venta (estos "Términos") son los únicos términos que rigen la venta de los componentes del sistema de combustible de gas natural comprimido ("Bienes") por Natural Gas Fuel Systems, LLC., operando bajo el nombre Cummins Clean Fuel Technologies ("Vendedor"), al comprador ("Comprador"). La factura del Vendedor y estos Términos (colectivamente, este "Acuerdo") constituyen el acuerdo completo entre las partes, y reemplazan todos los entendimientos, acuerdos, negociaciones, representaciones y garantías previas o contemporáneas, y comunicaciones, tanto escritas como orales. Estos Términos prevalecen sobre cualquier término y condición general de compra del Comprador, independientemente de si o cuándo el Comprador ha presentado su orden de compra o tales términos. El cumplimiento de la orden del Comprador no constituye la aceptación de ningún término y condición del Comprador y no sirve para modificar o enmendar estos Términos. No obstante cualquier cosa aquí en contrario, si existe un contrato escrito firmado por ambas partes que cubra la venta de los Bienes aquí cubiertos, los términos y condiciones de dicho contrato prevalecerán en la medida en que sean inconsistentes con estos Términos.
  2. Entrega. La entrega se realizará FOB en las instalaciones del Vendedor por el método preferido por el Comprador si se indica en la orden de compra del Comprador. A menos que las partes acuerden lo contrario por escrito, el Vendedor utilizará sus métodos estándar para empaquetar los Bienes y tenerlos preparados para su envío en las instalaciones del Vendedor (el "Punto de Entrega"). La entrega se considerará realizada cuando los Bienes hayan sido entregados en el Punto de Entrega y cargados en un transportista común para su entrega. El Comprador será responsable de todos los costos de descarga y proporcionará el equipo y la mano de obra razonablemente adecuados para la recepción de los Bienes en el destino (la "Ubicación de Entrega"). El Vendedor puede, a su exclusivo criterio, sin responsabilidad ni penalización, hacer envíos parciales de Bienes al Comprador. Cada envío constituirá una venta separada, y el Comprador pagará por las unidades enviadas, ya sea que dicho envío sea en cumplimiento total o parcial de la orden de compra del Comprador.
  3. Facturación. Tras la entrega, el Vendedor emitirá una factura al Comprador que establecerá lo siguiente: (i) el número de orden de compra del Comprador; (ii) la Ubicación de Entrega; (iii) una descripción de los Bienes; (iv) el precio de los Bienes; (v) costos de flete; y (vi) impuestos y otras tasas. A menos que se indique específicamente en la Factura, el precio en la Factura no incluye impuestos sobre las ventas o el uso, ni impuestos ocupacionales basados en el volumen de ventas (federales, estatales o locales). El Vendedor no facturará el Impuesto Federal sobre el Consumo y no remitirá ningún Impuesto Federal sobre el Consumo. El Comprador acuerda pagar cualquier impuesto impuesto o aplicable a la transacción. Todas las facturas serán en Dólares Estadounidenses, a menos que se indique específicamente lo contrario.
  4. Términos de Pago. El Comprador pagará todas las cantidades facturadas adeudadas al Vendedor dentro de los 30 días a partir de la fecha de la factura del Vendedor. El Comprador pagará intereses sobre todos los pagos atrasados a la menor de las tasas del 1.5% por mes o la tasa más alta permitida por la ley aplicable, calculados diariamente y compuestos mensualmente. El Comprador reembolsará al Vendedor todos los costos incurridos en la cobranza de cualquier pago atrasado, incluidos, sin limitación, los honorarios de abogados. Además de todos los demás remedios disponibles bajo estos Términos o por ley (que el Vendedor no renuncia al ejercer cualquier derecho aquí bajo), el Vendedor tendrá derecho a suspender la entrega de cualquier Bien si el Comprador no paga cualquier cantidad cuando se deba aquí bajo y tal incumplimiento continúa por 5 días después de la notificación por escrito de ello. El Comprador no retendrá el pago de ninguna cantidad adeudada y pagadera por motivo de cualquier compensación de cualquier reclamación o disputa con el Vendedor, ya sea en relación con el incumplimiento, la quiebra o de otro tipo del Vendedor.
  5. Título y Riesgo de Pérdida. El título y el riesgo de pérdida pasan al Comprador tras la entrega de los Bienes en el Punto de Entrega. Como garantía colateral para el pago del precio de compra de los Bienes, el Comprador concede al Vendedor un derecho de retención y una garantía sobre todos los derechos, títulos e intereses del Comprador en, sobre y bajo los Bienes, dondequiera que se encuentren, y ya sea ahora existentes o adquiridos de tiempo en tiempo, y en todos los accesorios a ellos y reemplazos o modificaciones de los mismos, así como en todos los ingresos (incluidos los ingresos del seguro) de lo anterior. La garantía concedida bajo esta disposición constituye una garantía de compra de acuerdo con el Código Comercial Uniforme de Texas.
  6. Inspección y Rechazo de Bienes No Conformes.(a) El Comprador inspeccionará los Bienes dentro de los 10 días de la recepción ("Período de Inspección"). El Comprador se considerará que ha aceptado los Bienes a menos que notifique al Vendedor por escrito de cualquier Bien No Conforme durante el Período de Inspección y proporcione dicha evidencia escrita u otra documentación según lo razonablemente requerido por el Vendedor. Para los propósitos de estos Términos, "Bienes No Conformes" significa solo lo siguiente: (i) el producto enviado es diferente al identificado en la orden de compra del Comprador; o (ii) la etiqueta o el empaque del producto identifica incorrectamente su contenido. Si el Comprador notifica oportunamente al Vendedor de cualquier Bien No Conforme, el Vendedor, a su exclusivo criterio, (i) reemplazará dichos Bienes No Conformes por Bienes conformes, o (ii) acreditará o reembolsará el Precio de dichos Bienes No Conformes, junto con cualquier gasto razonable de envío y manejo incurrido por el Comprador en relación con ello. El Comprador enviará, a cargo y riesgo del Vendedor, los Bienes No Conformes a las instalaciones del Vendedor según lo instruido por el Vendedor. Si el Vendedor ejerce su opción de reemplazar Bienes No Conformes, el Vendedor, después de recibir el envío del Comprador de los Bienes No Conformes, enviará al Comprador, a cargo y riesgo del Comprador, los Bienes reemplazados a la Ubicación de Entrega o tal ubicación alternativa designada por el Comprador. El Comprador reconoce y acuerda que los remedios establecidos en la Sección 6 son los remedios exclusivos del Comprador para la entrega de Bienes No Conformes. Excepto como se establece en la Sección 6, todas las ventas de Bienes al Comprador se hacen en una base de un solo sentido y el Comprador no tiene derecho a devolver Bienes comprados bajo este Acuerdo al Vendedor.
  7. Garantía Limitada. La garantía limitada que cubre los bienes se proporciona por separado al Comprador e incorporada aquí por referencia. EXCEPTO POR LA GARANTÍA LIMITADA PROPORCIONADA AL COMPRADOR, EL VENDEDOR NO HACE NINGUNA GARANTÍA ADICIONAL CON RESPECTO A LOS BIENES.
  8. Limitación de Responsabilidad. EN NINGÚN CASO EL VENDEDOR SERÁ RESPONSABLE DE NINGÚN DAÑO CONSECUENCIAL, INDIRECTO, INCIDENTAL, ESPECIAL, EJEMPLAR, O PUNITIVO, PÉRDIDAS DE BENEFICIOS O INGRESOS O DISMINUCIÓN DEL VALOR, QUE SURJAN O SE RELACIONEN CON CUALQUIER INCUMPLIMIENTO DE ESTOS TÉRMINOS, YA SEA O NO QUE LA POSIBILIDAD DE TALES DAÑOS HAYA SIDO DIVULGADA ANTICIPADAMENTE POR EL COMPRADOR O PODRÍA HABER SIDO RAZONABLEMENTE PREVISTA POR EL COMPRADOR, INDEPENDIENTEMENTE DE LA TEORÍA LEGAL O EQUITATIVA (CONTRATO, AGRAVIO U OTRA) EN LA QUE SE BASE LA RECLAMACIÓN, Y NO OBSTANTE EL FRACASO DE CUALQUIER REMEDIO ACORDADO O OTRO DE SU PROPÓSITO ESENCIAL. EN NINGÚN CASO LA RESPONSABILIDAD TOTAL DEL VENDEDOR QUE SURJA O SE RELACIONE CON ESTE ACUERDO, YA SEA QUE SURJA O SE RELACIONE CON EL INCUMPLIMIENTO DEL CONTRATO, AGRAVIO (INCLUYENDO NEGLIGENCIA) U OTRO, EXCEDERÁ EL TOTAL DE LAS CANTIDADES PAGADAS AL VENDEDOR POR LOS BIENES VENDIDOS AQUÍ.
  9. Renuncia. Ninguna renuncia por parte del Vendedor de cualquiera de las disposiciones de este Acuerdo será efectiva a menos que se establezca explícitamente por escrito y firmada por el Vendedor. Ningún incumplimiento en el ejercicio, o retraso en el ejercicio, de cualquier derecho, remedio, poder o privilegio que surja de este Acuerdo operará, o podrá interpretarse, como una renuncia del mismo. Ningún ejercicio único o parcial de cualquier derecho, remedio, poder o privilegio aquí impedirá cualquier otro o más ejercicio del mismo o el ejercicio de cualquier otro derecho, remedio, poder o privilegio.
  10. Información Confidencial. Toda información confidencial, no pública o propietaria del Vendedor, incluyendo pero no limitado a especificaciones, muestras, diseños, planes, dibujos, documentos, datos, operaciones comerciales, precios, descuentos o rebajas, divulgados por el Vendedor al Comprador, ya sea divulgados oralmente o divulgados o accesados en forma escrita, electrónica u otra forma o medio, y ya sea que esté marcada, designada o identificada de otro modo como "confidencial" en conexión con la compra de Bienes es confidencial y no puede ser divulgada o copiada a menos que sea autorizado previamente por el Vendedor por escrito. Esta Sección no se aplica a la información que: (a) esté en el dominio público; (b) sea conocida por el Comprador en el momento de la divulgación; o (c) sea obtenida legítimamente por el Comprador de forma no confidencial de un tercero.
  11. Sin Beneficiarios de Terceros. Este Acuerdo es para el beneficio exclusivo de las partes del mismo y sus respectivos sucesores y cesionarios permitidos y nada aquí, expresa o implícitamente, está destinado a conferir o conferirá a ninguna otra persona o entidad ningún derecho, beneficio o remedio legal o equitativo de ninguna naturaleza bajo o por motivo de estos Términos.
  12. Ley Aplicable. Todos los asuntos que surjan o se relacionen con este Acuerdo se rigen por y se interpretan de acuerdo con las leyes internas del Estado de Texas sin dar efecto a ninguna disposición o regla de elección o conflicto de leyes (ya sea del Estado de Texas o de cualquier otra jurisdicción) que cause la aplicación de las leyes de cualquier jurisdicción distinta a las del Estado de Texas.
  13. Sumisión a la Jurisdicción. Cualquier demanda, acción o procedimiento legal que surja o se relacione con este Acuerdo se instituirá en los tribunales federales de los Estados Unidos de América o en los tribunales del Estado de Texas en cada caso ubicados en la Ciudad de San Antonio y el Condado de Bexar, y cada parte se somete irrevocablemente a la jurisdicción exclusiva de dichos tribunales en cualquier demanda, acción o procedimiento.
  14. Notificaciones. Todas las notificaciones, solicitudes, consentimientos, reclamaciones, demandas, renuncias y otras comunicaciones en virtud del presente (cada una, una "Notificación") serán por escrito y dirigidas a las partes en las direcciones establecidas en la factura del Vendedor o a tal otra dirección que pueda ser designada por la parte receptora por escrito. Todas las Notificaciones serán entregadas por entrega personal, mensajero nacionalmente reconocido de la noche a la mañana (con todas las tarifas pagadas por adelantado) o correo certificado o registrado (en cada caso, con acuse de recibo solicitado, franqueo pagado por adelantado). Excepto según lo dispuesto en este Acuerdo, una Notificación es efectiva solo (a) al recibo de la parte receptora, y (b) si la parte que da la Notificación ha cumplido con los requisitos de esta Sección.
  15. Ejecución y Entrega por Transmisión Electrónica. Si cualquier documento ejecutado en conexión con una orden de Bienes se entrega por fax, correo electrónico o dispositivo similar de transmisión electrónica instantánea mediante el cual se pueda ver la firma de o en nombre de tal parte, dicha ejecución y entrega se considerará válida, vinculante y efectiva para todos los propósitos como un documento original. Cualquier documento enviado por fax o correo electrónico se considerará que tiene el mismo efecto legal vinculante que un documento original. A solicitud del Vendedor, cualquier documento enviado por fax o correo electrónico será reejecutado por el Comprador en forma original.
  16. Divisibilidad. Si cualquier término o disposición de este Acuerdo es inválido, ilegal o inaplicable en cualquier jurisdicción, tal invalidez, ilegalidad o inaplicabilidad no afectará ningún otro término o disposición de este Acuerdo ni invalidará o hará inaplicable tal término o disposición en cualquier otra jurisdicción.

Document_Clauses.Name: Claim Form
Document_Clauses.DxCPQ__Body__c:
Terms and Conditions for Claim Submission

  1. Eligibility for Claim Submission
  2. The claimant must be a policyholder or an authorized representative of the policyholder under an active insurance policy with Dextara Datamatics .
  3. Claims must be submitted within the specified time frame as outlined in the insurance policy documentation. Failure to file within this period may result in claim denial.
  4. Accuracy of Information
  5. The claimant is required to provide accurate and truthful information when completing the claim form. Any misrepresentation, falsification, or omission of material facts may result in claim rejection and could lead to the cancellation of the insurance policy. Additionally, the insurance company reserves the right to verify all information provided.
  6. Supporting Documentation
  7. The claimant must submit all relevant and necessary supporting documentation along with the claim form, including but not limited to police reports, medical bills, repair estimates, receipts, and photographs. Failure to provide sufficient documentation may delay claim processing or result in claim denial.
  8. Claim Investigation
  9. Upon receiving the claim form, Dextara Datamatics reserves the right to investigate the incident thoroughly. This may include obtaining statements from witnesses, reviewing documentation, or conducting site visits as necessary. The claimant agrees to cooperate fully during the investigation process.
  10. Processing Time
  11. Once all required information and documentation have been received, Dextara Datamatics will process the claim within a reasonable time frame. Claimants will be notified of the claim status (approved, denied, or pending further information) within 30 days of submission unless exceptional circumstances arise.
  12. Claim Approval and Payment
  13. If the claim is approved, Dextara Datamatics will reimburse the claimant in accordance with the policy terms and conditions, less any applicable deductibles. Payment will be made via the bank account details provided by the claimant in the claim form.
  14. Claim Denial
  15. Dextara Datamatics reserves the right to deny any claim that is deemed to be ineligible, incomplete, fraudulent, or unsupported by sufficient documentation. Claimants will receive a written explanation outlining the reason for the denial, and they have the right to appeal the decision within 30 days.
  16. Limitation of Liability
  17. Dextara Datamatics is not liable for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages resulting from the denial, delay, or processing of claims. The maximum liability of Dextara Datamatics is limited to the coverage amounts specified in the claimant's policy.
  18. Dispute Resolution
  19. In the event of a dispute arising from a denied claim, the claimant agrees to engage in a mediation process as outlined in the policy documentation. If mediation fails, the dispute will be settled in accordance with applicable state laws.
  20. Confidentiality
  21. The claimant’s personal and claim-related information will be kept confidential and will not be shared with any third parties except as required by law or necessary for the claim processing and investigation.
  22. Governing Law
  23. These Terms and Conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India, and any legal proceedings arising out of these terms will be handled in the jurisdiction of the claimant’s policy agreement.

Privacy Policy for Claim Submission

  1. Collection of Information
  2. We collect personal and claim-related information provided by the claimant, including but not limited to, name, address, contact details, policy number, and details of the incident. This information is used solely for the purpose of processing and investigating your claim.
  3. Use of Information
  4. The information provided by the claimant will be used to evaluate the legitimacy of the claim, communicate with the claimant regarding the claim’s status, and issue payment where applicable. We may also use this information to detect and prevent fraudulent claims.
  5. Sharing of Information
  6. Your personal information will not be shared with third parties unless necessary for the investigation or processing of your claim (e.g., engaging third-party investigators or repair contractors). We may also be required to share information with legal authorities if mandated by law.
  7. Security Measures
  8. Dextara Datamatics implements strict data protection measures to ensure that all personal information is securely stored and protected against unauthorized access, disclosure, or modification.
  9. Access to Information
  10. Claimants have the right to access, modify, or request the deletion of their personal information held by Dextara Datamatics. To request such changes, claimants can contact our customer service department.
  11. Retention of Information
  12. Personal and claim-related information will be retained for as long as necessary to process the claim and comply with legal obligations. Information may be archived in accordance with our data retention policies.

Refund and Cancellation Policy for Insurance Claims

  1. Refunds for Overpayments
  2. In cases where overpayments have been made due to incorrect claim amounts, Dextara Datamatics will issue a refund to the claimant within 30 days of discovering the overpayment. Refunds will be made to the original payment method or bank account specified by the claimant.
  3. No Refund for Denied Claims
  4. If a claim is denied due to ineligibility, policy exclusions, or fraud, the claimant is not entitled to any refunds of premiums paid or other fees.
  5. Cancellation of Insurance Coverage
  6. Claimants who have submitted fraudulent claims or misrepresented information may have their insurance coverage canceled without prior notice. Any refunds of premiums will be governed by the policy terms at the time of cancellation.
  7. Appeal Process for Denied Claims
  8. Claimants who wish to appeal a denied claim must do so within 30 days of receiving the denial notice. If the appeal is successful, any payments owed will be issued promptly.

Disclaimer

  1. General Disclaimer
  2. The information provided on this claim form and its accompanying terms, conditions, and policies is intended to provide guidance for claim submission. However, nothing herein modifies the terms of the policyholder’s insurance contract, which prevails in the event of any inconsistencies.
  3. Changes to Terms and Conditions
  4. Dextara Datamatics reserves the right to modify or update these terms and conditions at any time without prior notice. Claimants are encouraged to review these terms periodically for any changes.

Template_Sections.Name: NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT (NDA)
Template_Sections.DxCPQ__Section_Content__c:
Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)


This Non-Disclosure Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of [Date] _________________________, by and between [Disclosing Party Name] _______________________of [Company Name/Address] _________________________________________ ("Disclosing Party") and [Receiving Party Name] __________________________________ of [Company Name/Address] ("Receiving Party").


1. Purpose

The Disclosing Party intends to disclose certain confidential and proprietary information (the "Confidential Information") to the Receiving Party for the purpose of [briefly describe the reason for the disclosure, such as “evaluating a potential business relationship,” “exploring investment opportunities,” or “developing a new product”] (the "Purpose"). The Receiving Party agrees to use the Confidential Information only for the stated Purpose and not for any other purposes.


2. Definition of Confidential Information

For the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" means all information disclosed by the Disclosing Party to the Receiving Party, either orally or in writing, which is designated as confidential or proprietary, or which should reasonably be understood to be confidential given the nature of the information or the circumstances of its disclosure. This includes, but is not limited to:

  • Business plans, strategies, and marketing data;
  • Financial information and projections;
  • Product designs, specifications, and prototypes;
  • Trade secrets, know-how, and intellectual property;
  • Client lists, vendor information, and customer data;
  • Any other proprietary information related to the Disclosing Party’s business.

3. Exclusions from Confidential Information

Confidential Information does not include information that: a. Was already known to the Receiving Party prior to disclosure by the Disclosing Party; b. Is or becomes publicly available through no fault of the Receiving Party; c. Is disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party who has the legal right to disclose such information; d. Is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information.


4. Obligations of the Receiving Party

The Receiving Party agrees to: a. Maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and take reasonable steps to protect it from unauthorized disclosure; b. Not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party; c. Use the Confidential Information solely for the Purpose and not for any other purpose; d. Restrict access to the Confidential Information to those employees, agents, or representatives of the Receiving Party who need to know such information for the Purpose, and ensure that such persons are bound by confidentiality obligations no less stringent than those contained in this Agreement.


5. Term and Return of Information

This Agreement will remain in effect for a period of [specify time period, such as "two (2) years"] from the date of disclosure of the Confidential Information. Upon the expiration of this Agreement or upon request by the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party agrees to promptly return or destroy all materials containing Confidential Information, including any copies, notes, or summaries thereof.


6. No License or Ownership Rights

Nothing in this Agreement grants the Receiving Party any rights in or to the Confidential Information, including any intellectual property rights. The Confidential Information remains the exclusive property of the Disclosing Party.


7. Legal Remedies

The Receiving Party acknowledges that any unauthorized disclosure or use of the Confidential Information may cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party, and that the Disclosing Party is entitled to seek injunctive relief in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity.


8. No Obligation to Proceed

Neither party is under any obligation to proceed with any business relationship or transaction as a result of this Agreement. This Agreement does not create any agency, partnership, or joint venture between the parties.


9. Governing Law

This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [State/Country], without regard to its conflict of law principles.


10. Entire Agreement and Amendments

This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties with respect to the subject matter herein and supersedes all prior discussions, agreements, and understandings of any kind. Any amendments to this Agreement must be made in writing and signed by both parties.


11. Miscellaneous

a. Severability: If any provision of this Agreement is found to be unenforceable, the remainder of this Agreement will remain in full force and effect.

b. Waiver: The failure of either party to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of that provision or any other provision.

c. Notices: Any notices or communications required or permitted under this Agreement must be in writing and delivered to the respective parties at the addresses provided above.


IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Non-Disclosure Agreement as of the date first above written.


[Disclosing Party Name] __________________________________________________

[Title, Company] ______________________________________________


[Receiving Party Name] ________________________________________________

[Title, Company] __________________________________________________

Template_Sections.Name: Community Success Stories
Template_Sections.DxCPQ__Section_Content__c:
Community Success Stories

Carlos’ Journey to College

Carlos, a participant in our mentorship program, has been accepted to the University of California! Coming from a low-income household, Carlos faced many challenges in pursuing higher education, but with the guidance of his mentor and the support of our college readiness workshops, he achieved his dream. "I never thought college was a real possibility for me," says Carlos. "But with the help of this program, I learned how to apply and even received scholarships. I’m so excited for the future."

We are so proud of Carlos and all the students who continue to push boundaries and strive for excellence.

Template_Sections.Name: Claim Form
Template_Sections.DxCPQ__Section_Content__c:
Terms and Conditions for Claim Submission

  1. Eligibility for Claim Submission
  2. The claimant must be a policyholder or an authorized representative of the policyholder under an active insurance policy with Dextara Datamatics .
  3. Claims must be submitted within the specified time frame as outlined in the insurance policy documentation. Failure to file within this period may result in claim denial.
  4. Accuracy of Information
  5. The claimant is required to provide accurate and truthful information when completing the claim form. Any misrepresentation, falsification, or omission of material facts may result in claim rejection and could lead to the cancellation of the insurance policy. Additionally, the insurance company reserves the right to verify all information provided.
  6. Supporting Documentation
  7. The claimant must submit all relevant and necessary supporting documentation along with the claim form, including but not limited to police reports, medical bills, repair estimates, receipts, and photographs. Failure to provide sufficient documentation may delay claim processing or result in claim denial.
  8. Claim Investigation
  9. Upon receiving the claim form, Dextara Datamatics reserves the right to investigate the incident thoroughly. This may include obtaining statements from witnesses, reviewing documentation, or conducting site visits as necessary. The claimant agrees to cooperate fully during the investigation process.
  10. Processing Time
  11. Once all required information and documentation have been received, Dextara Datamatics will process the claim within a reasonable time frame. Claimants will be notified of the claim status (approved, denied, or pending further information) within 30 days of submission unless exceptional circumstances arise.
  12. Claim Approval and Payment
  13. If the claim is approved, Dextara Datamatics will reimburse the claimant in accordance with the policy terms and conditions, less any applicable deductibles. Payment will be made via the bank account details provided by the claimant in the claim form.
  14. Claim Denial
  15. Dextara Datamatics reserves the right to deny any claim that is deemed to be ineligible, incomplete, fraudulent, or unsupported by sufficient documentation. Claimants will receive a written explanation outlining the reason for the denial, and they have the right to appeal the decision within 30 days.
  16. Limitation of Liability
  17. Dextara Datamatics is not liable for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages resulting from the denial, delay, or processing of claims. The maximum liability of Dextara Datamatics is limited to the coverage amounts specified in the claimant's policy.
  18. Dispute Resolution
  19. In the event of a dispute arising from a denied claim, the claimant agrees to engage in a mediation process as outlined in the policy documentation. If mediation fails, the dispute will be settled in accordance with applicable state laws.
  20. Confidentiality
  21. The claimant’s personal and claim-related information will be kept confidential and will not be shared with any third parties except as required by law or necessary for the claim processing and investigation.
  22. Governing Law
  23. These Terms and Conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India, and any legal proceedings arising out of these terms will be handled in the jurisdiction of the claimant’s policy agreement.

Privacy Policy for Claim Submission

  1. Collection of Information
  2. We collect personal and claim-related information provided by the claimant, including but not limited to, name, address, contact details, policy number, and details of the incident. This information is used solely for the purpose of processing and investigating your claim.
  3. Use of Information
  4. The information provided by the claimant will be used to evaluate the legitimacy of the claim, communicate with the claimant regarding the claim’s status, and issue payment where applicable. We may also use this information to detect and prevent fraudulent claims.
  5. Sharing of Information
  6. Your personal information will not be shared with third parties unless necessary for the investigation or processing of your claim (e.g., engaging third-party investigators or repair contractors). We may also be required to share information with legal authorities if mandated by law.
  7. Security Measures
  8. Dextara Datamatics implements strict data protection measures to ensure that all personal information is securely stored and protected against unauthorized access, disclosure, or modification.
  9. Access to Information
  10. Claimants have the right to access, modify, or request the deletion of their personal information held by Dextara Datamatics. To request such changes, claimants can contact our customer service department.
  11. Retention of Information
  12. Personal and claim-related information will be retained for as long as necessary to process the claim and comply with legal obligations. Information may be archived in accordance with our data retention policies.

Refund and Cancellation Policy for Insurance Claims

  1. Refunds for Overpayments
  2. In cases where overpayments have been made due to incorrect claim amounts, Dextara Datamatics will issue a refund to the claimant within 30 days of discovering the overpayment. Refunds will be made to the original payment method or bank account specified by the claimant.
  3. No Refund for Denied Claims
  4. If a claim is denied due to ineligibility, policy exclusions, or fraud, the claimant is not entitled to any refunds of premiums paid or other fees.
  5. Cancellation of Insurance Coverage
  6. Claimants who have submitted fraudulent claims or misrepresented information may have their insurance coverage canceled without prior notice. Any refunds of premiums will be governed by the policy terms at the time of cancellation.
  7. Appeal Process for Denied Claims
  8. Claimants who wish to appeal a denied claim must do so within 30 days of receiving the denial notice. If the appeal is successful, any payments owed will be issued promptly.

Disclaimer

  1. General Disclaimer
  2. The information provided on this claim form and its accompanying terms, conditions, and policies is intended to provide guidance for claim submission. However, nothing herein modifies the terms of the policyholder’s insurance contract, which prevails in the event of any inconsistencies.
  3. Changes to Terms and Conditions
  4. Dextara Datamatics reserves the right to modify or update these terms and conditions at any time without prior notice. Claimants are encouraged to review these terms periodically for any changes.

Template_Sections.Name: Upcoming Events
Template_Sections.DxCPQ__Section_Content__c:
Upcoming Events

1. Annual Fundraising Gala

October 15, 2024 | 6 PM - 9 PM | Grand Hall, City Center

Join us for a glamorous evening celebrating our achievements and raising funds for future projects. The night will feature a live auction, gourmet dinner, and entertainment. Secure your tickets here.

2. Community Health Fair

October 22, 2024 | 9 AM - 3 PM | Springfield Park

We’re partnering with local health organizations to offer free screenings, flu shots, and wellness education. Bring your family and friends for a day of health and fun.

3. Volunteer Appreciation Day

November 5, 2024 | 1 PM - 4 PM | Our Main Office

We couldn’t do it without our volunteers! Join us as we celebrate and recognize the amazing individuals who dedicate their time to our cause. RSVP here.


Volunteer Spotlight

Meet Sarah Johnson

Sarah has been a dedicated volunteer with our organization for the past three years, working tirelessly in our tutoring program for underserved youth. Thanks to her patience and dedication, countless students have improved their academic performance and confidence. Sarah’s positive energy and passion for helping others make her a true inspiration to all of us. Thank you, Sarah, for your continued commitment!

Template_Sections.Name: Donor Acknowledgment
Template_Sections.DxCPQ__Section_Content__c:
Donor Acknowledgment

A heartfelt thank you to all our donors for their generosity. Your support enables us to provide life-changing services to the community. We would like to acknowledge the following major donors this month:

  • John and Mary Smith
  • The Springfield Business Association
  • Green Earth Foundation
  • Anonymous Donor

Template_Sections.Name: Get Involved
Template_Sections.DxCPQ__Section_Content__c:
Get Involved

Join Our Volunteer Team

We’re always looking for passionate individuals to join our team. Whether you want to mentor youth, assist in our community gardens, or help with administrative work, there’s a role for everyone. Learn more about volunteer opportunities and sign up here.

Donate to Support Our Programs

Your donations help us provide vital services to our community. Every dollar makes a difference. Consider making a one-time or recurring donation today to ensure we can continue to serve those in need. Click here to donate.

Template_Sections.Name: CEO's Message
Template_Sections.DxCPQ__Section_Content__c:
Message from the CEO

Dear Friends,


As we welcome the fall season, I want to take a moment to express my deepest gratitude for your continued support. Together, we’ve made significant progress in serving our community. From expanding our after-school programs to launching new health initiatives, none of this would be possible without you.


This newsletter highlights the accomplishments of the past month and previews what’s ahead. We are excited to share our plans for future events and initiatives, as we aim to make a lasting impact in the lives of those we serve.


Warm Regards,

Sreekanth Lapala

CEO, Dextara Datamatics
